channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: John Bateman has lifted the lid on his contract situation with the Raiders, who are all but resigned to losing the Englishman in 2021.
item.title: 'They will drive me to my next club': Bateman lifts lid on contract saga with Raiders

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Webb
item.description: Allowing just 20 people at at time in the Domed Reading Room is among strict rules being considered for the State Library of Victoria re-opening.
item.title: 'Careful and cautious': State Library of Victoria won't open on June 1

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: The uproar was immediate when it was revealed the Raiders would grace free-to-air television just three times this NRL season.
item.title: 'We argue for more every year': Why the Raiders can't get a fair crack on FTA

item.dc:creator: Anna Prytz
item.description: Victorian families are feeling excitement and trepidation about the return of classroom teaching.
item.title: Mixed emotions as kids head back to school

item.dc:creator: Clay Lucas
item.description: A company that leases apartments to Chinese students in Melbourne has deregistered itself, owing renters from China thousands of dollars each.
item.title: Scores of Chinese students lose money after property agency disappears

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victorians allowed gatherings of 20 people; tourist accommodation, cafes, pubs and restaurants to reopen from June 1

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: The federal government has provided a three-step roadmap to start carefully relaxing limits on our movement. Here's how each state is easing its coronavirus restrictions.
item.title: COVID-19: What are the public health rules now?

item.dc:creator: Fran Rimrod
item.description: About 30,000 Western Power customers across the state have been affected by power outages and problems caused by the storm so far, with the service provider already receiving more than 5000 calls.
item.title: WA storm LIVE: Hundreds of calls for help and thousands lose power around the state

item.description: Swells of up to 10 metres have been recorded off Sydney's coast over the weekend weekend and the wet and windy conditions are expected to continue until Tuesday.
item.title: Huge waves recorded off Sydney's coast

item.dc:creator: Alex Druce
item.description: Australian stocks are tipped to rise on Monday as investors ponder whether an escalating tit-for-tat trade spat will be enough to take the gloss off easing lockdowns and sink a post-COVID market rally.
item.title: ASX tipped to open strong continuing market rally

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Fiona Kotvojs has rubbished claims she does not want action on climate change, marking the opening stoush of the Eden-Monaro byelection campaign.
item.title: Liberal candidate opens key byelection battle with climate pledge

item.description: President Donald Trump and Secretary of State Mike Pompeo have repeatedly said they suspect the virus that was first detected in Wuhan was somehow released from the laboratory.
item.title: Wuhan lab head calls virus leak claims 'pure fabrication'

item.description: A 39-year-old man died shortly after emergency services were called to a home in Riverstone about 12.30am on Sunday.
item.title: Teenagers charged with murder after Sydney home invasion

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: The Coalition needs to refocus on what the subsidy actually does while offering transparency about the embarrassing stuff-up on what it costs.
item.title: Government must restore public faith after JobKeeper bungle

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: A diplomatic balancing act looms for Australian cricket from this week when a decision could be made on the future of the Twenty20 World Cup.
item.title: 'CA will want to keep India happy': Taylor on Australia's IPL dilemma

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Experts say a range of other viruses have been squashed along with COVID-19, and social distancing is keeping them at bay.
item.title: The other diseases the coronavirus lockdown stopped in their tracks

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: "I'm doing the last edition today and then I will continue when the next world pandemic happens," says the Brisbane boy who can't wait to see his mates again.
item.title: Isolation Times newspaper bites the dust as Hugo, 7, goes back to school

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: In further good news for Queensland kids, community sporting clubs can restart "small group training" from 11.59pm on June 12.
item.title: 'It’s going to be a big day': Students in years 2-10 return to school

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: Basketball Victoria chief has also urged state government to give community sporting bodies a road map for how they can get back playing.
item.title: Basketball Victoria eyes July 13 return for local hoops

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: Health Minister Brad Hazzard warned against complacency as the state government opens up more industries.
item.title: 'Don't relax': Sydney on high alert as zoos, aquariums and salons ready to open

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: More than a quarter of a million small businesses are not fully eligible for JobKeeper because the payment is restricted to one partner in a partnership.
item.title: 'Really disappointing': Business partners forced to share one JobKeeper Payment

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: The federal government on Sunday released the Return to Sport Toolkit - a set of guidelines that outlines how clubs can safely operate when sport returns.
item.title: One parent only, no team huddles: rules for community sport return

item.description: Track improving to around soft 5 and rail true from 950m to 400m, then out 3m the remainder so likely pattern just off the speed.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Albury on Monday

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Ciaron Maher has added to his status as one of the leading jumps trainers in modern racing, collecting Sunday's Australian Steeplechase with Bit Of A Lad.
item.title: Maher confirms standing as premier jumps trainer

item.description: Prominent activitist Tam Tak-chi was arrested during the protests for what police said was an unauthorised assembly.
item.title: Hong Kong police fire tear gas as protests escalate

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: Robbie Dolan wants to win another apprentice title after outriding his claim as fellow apprentice Lousie Day marks her mark in town.
item.title: Claim-less Dolan targets back-to-back apprentice crowns

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Webb
item.description: Artists are "hanging out to get back to work" when restrictions ease in Victoria next month, says Miao, who owns Prahran small theatre The MC Showroom.
item.title: Life can be a cabaret again, as theatres prepare to reopen

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Private equity giant Bain Capital has sought to allay concerns it will be a "cut-and-run" investor if it wins the bidding race for Virgin Australia.
item.title: Bain says it will stick with Virgin Australia 'for the long haul'

item.description: Not since two wins less than a month apart last spring has the fast-finishing five-year-old daughter of Zariz saluted.
item.title: Canberra mare Milamoo due for a salute after close calls

item.dc:creator: Pallavi Singhal
item.description: Swells of up to 10 metres have been recorded this weekend and the wet and windy conditions are expected to continue until Tuesday.
item.title: 'Stay out of the water': Huge waves recorded off Sydney's coast

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: Cian English, 19, has been named as the victim. Police said his family in Brisbane have been left "shattered".
item.title: Teen 'trying to escape vicious assault' when he fell from balcony

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Joel Selwood says his club must prioritise Jack Steven's welfare over any public interest in finding out how the Cats recruit ended up in hospital with a stab wound.
item.title: Jack Steven's welfare must come first, says Cats captain Joel Selwood

item.description: Oldies invented wasting time. We are Queensland’s experts at all hobbies: knitting, jigsaws, books, baking, crafts, model aeroplanes, internet porn… did you know we are also a very techno-savvy generation?
item.title: Emerging from isolation, oldies are forced to be nice to people again

item.dc:creator: Lauren Pilat
item.description: “There will be places to get waves but for the most part this whole coastline is going to get hammered and no one should be out," Margaret River surfer Tom Walker warns.
item.title: 'No one should be out': Experienced WA surfer warns of catching waves in monster swell

item.dc:creator: Roy Masters
item.description: When the Broncos and Eels clash on Thursday, the NRL will be the only live football competition in the English-speaking world. But international rights-holders Fox Sports are not adequately promoting the game.
item.title: With NRL in league of its own, Fox must make it the world game

item.description: Former Australian captain Mark Taylor says Steve Waugh made the wrong decision in dropping Shane Warne for the final Test against the West Indies in 1999.
item.title: Waugh call to drop Warne in '99 was wrong: Taylor

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: As coronavirus restrictions ease, the NRL has its sights set on taking the next step much earlier than anticipated.
item.title: 'We're on the moon, now for Mars': V'landys aims for crowds from July 1

item.dc:creator: Fran Rimrod
item.description: WA has had another day of zero new cases of COVID-19 overnight as Premier Mark McGowan continues to vividly defend his decision to keep borders to the rest of Australia shut.
item.title: No new COVID-19 cases for WA after Premier Mark McGowan forced to defend border stance

item.description: Peter O'Neill was arrested by police at Jackson's International Airport in Port Moresby on Saturday after flying back from Brisbane.
item.title: Former PNG prime minister arrested over corruption charges

item.description: A selection of his best work.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Davidson

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: A farm-focused scheme to benefit biodiversity and farmers has been widely praised but comes with a warning over environmental risks.
item.title: World-first biodiversity scheme could help farmers cash in

item.description: The technology comes as the Vatican announced its museums will reopen, ending a coronavirus closure that has drained the Holy See's coffers.
item.title: Florence's Duomo reopens with a buzz to keep visitors in line

item.description: A Perth woman woke in the early hours of Sunday morning to an alleged sexual predator standing over her as she laid in her own bed.
item.title: Wembley woman woken by attacker standing over her

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: The Prime Minister likened the $60 billion shortfall in spending on JobKeeper to receiving a cheaper bill for building a house.
item.title: Morrison accepts responsibility for JobKeeper blunder

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Less than a quarter of funds allocated by the Berejiklian government to support wildlife carers during the height of the state's bushfire season have been spent on the intended target six months after their announcement.
item.title: Wildlife carers still in the hunt for fire support funds six months on

item.description: Don't worry too much about the impact of remote learning on students. The real issue is how we might repair, rather than resume, our education system.
item.title: It's the right time for less time in class

item.dc:creator: Madeleine Heffernan
item.description: A group of high-fee Victorian private schools is pushing to establish a student quarantine hub to fast-track the return of international students.
item.title: Victorian private schools push student quarantine hub

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, May 24, 2020
